timeline.bodyText: Any reason not to log this? Unless it's common, it's a new feature and might be helpful in figuring out what is going wrong.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Hadn't noticed this before, but it would be nice if the keys were at least constants. But this is already like this in several places, so don't bother
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: You're not getting a quay token
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Interesting, hadn't noticed/clicked until now that you're doing this for the entry, not the version. This means it's getting the license for the repo. Is it going off the default branch? Probably fine for now, but I wonder if we eventually need to track at the version level. It's rare that licenses change, although I've seen it, and I don't know if they're retroactive or not -- I guess it depends on how the license content.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: GitHub doesn't track it at version level. There was quite a bit of discussion when this was a draft PR. Check out my PR message (before all the edits)
replies.author: garyluu
